Emails like <mailto:u5486365758@gmail.com|u5486365758@gmail.com> show up again and again after I deleted them manually and they don’t get blocked by the rate limiting feature or current Cloudflare rules. Could you help us out with this? Fine if it delays other tasks for this quarter, more important to solve the spam

Currently we have honeypot and rate limiting set up on forms. We are looking into adding another layer of security to them to block these.

, our senior developer, is looking into it and will get back to with updates tomorrow.

replies.text:
<@U059AC59LLF>
Following our recent investigation into the spam form submissions, here’s a quick summary of what we’ve found and the next steps we’re taking to resolve the issue:

What We Found :
• The spam entries are automated and originate from a small set of *rotating IP ranges*.
• All emails follow the same pattern — addresses like *u##########@gmail.com.*
• The spam bot consistently uses *fake browser user agents*, allowing us to identify its traffic reliably.
• The current rate-limiting rules were *only partially effective*, as the bot changes IPs within the same subnet to bypass restrictions.
What We’re Planning to Do:
*1. Enable Cloudflare Turnstile*
 We recommend enabling *Cloudflare Turnstile* (a privacy-friendly CAPTCHA alternative) to block automated submissions.
 Please enable Turnstile in your Cloudflare account and share the *site key* and *secret key* with us.
 Once we have those, we’ll integrate Turnstile directly into your Gravity Form.
*2. Improve the Rate-Limiting Plugin*
 We’ll enhance the plugin by adding a *regex-based email blocklist*.
 This will automatically reject addresses matching the pattern *u##########@gmail.com* before submission.
*3. Apply a Temporary Cloudflare Challenge (IP Range + User-Agent Rule)*
 Since the spam originates from a predictable set of IP ranges and user agents, we’ll create a *combined Cloudflare rule* to target both.
 This rule will temporarily place suspicious requests in *Challenge mode*, allowing us to confirm they’re automated bots without affecting legitimate visitors.
 Once verified, we’ll safely switch the rule to *Block* for full protection.

 Attached is the list of spam email submissions from the *last 7 days* matching this pattern — this should help illustrate the activity we’ve been monitoring.
 CC <@U039WK9NWA0>

Hi <@U059AC59LLF>,
I checked our Cloudflare access, and it looks like our current *Domain Administrator* role doesn’t include permissions to enable *Turnstile* or create *account-level Firewall/IP rules*.
To move forward with the spam protection updates, we’ll need either *Super Administrator* access or temporary elevated permissions to manage these settings.
Once that’s granted, we can set up Turnstile and apply the IP range rules right away to strengthen the form protection.
CC <@U039WK9NWA0>

We received 2 user reports that the captcha on <https://www.stackedmarketer.com/advertise-with-us/> is not working/not letting them submit the info. I think this might be since the update to Turnstile so bringing up here for a debug

elements.text: We received 2 user reports that the captcha on
is not working/not letting them submit the info. I think this might be since the update to Turnstile so bringing up here for a debug

replies.text:
<@U059AC59LLF>
I’ve looked into the Turnstile analytics, and here’s a quick overview of the data:
• *Challenges issued*: 5.35k
• *Challenges solved*: 4.26k (79.58% human solve rate)
• *Challenges unsolved*: 1.09k (20.42% bot traffic)
It seems that most challenges are being solved by real users (79.58%), but there’s still a noticeable percentage (20.42%) of likely bot traffic. This could be affecting the user experience on the form.

The issue seems to be related to *invisible mode* for Turnstile, which might not be triggering correctly for some users, causing them to be unable to submit the form.

To address this, I’d recommend *enabling the Managed Mode* for Turnstile. This mode automatically adjusts the challenge behavior, making it more responsive and adaptive, and helps improve the experience for real users while still blocking bots effectively.

I need your approval to enable this, as it will display the Turnstile challenge under the submission forms. Please confirm if you're okay with this change.

replies.text: Will it enable Turnstile challenge under all submissions or only when it thinks it’s unsure it’s a bot or not?

elements.text: Will it enable Turnstile challenge under all submissions or only when it thinks it’s unsure it’s a bot or not?

replies.text: We don’t want to make it so that literally everyone has to do the challenge

elements.text: We don’t want to make it so that literally everyone has to do the challenge

replies.text: So making high-risk users do the challenge seems like the way to go, if possible

elements.text: So making high-risk users do the challenge seems like the way to go, if possible

replies.text: Yes, exactly — enabling *Managed Mode* will show the Turnstile challenge *only to high-risk users*. For regular users, it will be solved automatically in the background, so the experience remains seamless for most users.

elements.text: . For regular users, it will be solved automatically in the background, so the experience remains seamless for most users.

replies.text:
Hi <@U059AC59LLF>
Quick update here.

We've implemented the recent anti-spam updates on the production site.
• *Cloudflare Turnstile* is now active on all Gravity Forms (using the _managed challenge_ mode to avoid interrupting real users).
• *Rate-Limiting Plugin* has been updated with a *regex-based email blocklist*.
    ◦ → Currently, it blocks emails that start with a letter followed by more than 7 digits — the common pattern among recent spam submissions.
• *Cloudflare Managed Challenge Rule* has been applied for the *suspicious IP ranges and user agents* identified from recent spam entries.
We monitored turnstile analytics and the Cloudflare security rule in the past few days, and everything seems okay.

Hi <@U059AC59LLF>,
The issue with Autopub was caused by the size of the document, particularly the large image files. After resizing one of the images, the Autopub  worked as expected.

I’ve attached a copy of the newsletter you shared, with a minor change [<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BmDo0_TfyXeNNHwb1EGjQbSbqJjtR3IZJ0yHyYilkU8/edit?usp=sharing>] (the first image has been resized).

This adjustment has resolved the issue, and everything is now working smoothly.

replies.text: Thanks, <@U02LDQX5TNU> - Do you have a rough guideline for image size? And is it resolution or file size of the image?

elements.text: - Do you have a rough guideline for image size? And is it resolution or file size of the image?

replies.text:
Hey <@U059AC59LLF>
Hope you’re doing well! Just wanted to give you a quick update. While resizing the image worked as a temporary fix, we dug a bit deeper to get to the root of the issue. Turns out, it was related to the ModSecurity request body size limit on the Cloudways server, which was set to 1 MB by default. We’ve increased the limit to 10 MB, so this should prevent the issue from happening again.
Please let me know if you run into any other issues.

CC <@U039WK9NWA0>

elements.text:
Hope you’re doing well! Just wanted to give you a quick update. While resizing the image worked as a temporary fix, we dug a bit deeper to get to the root of the issue. Turns out, it was related to the ModSecurity request body size limit on the Cloudways server, which was set to 1 MB by default. We’ve increased the limit to 10 MB, so this should prevent the issue from happening again.
Please let me know if you run into any other issues.

CC

replies.text: Thanks, that sounds great. And yeah, was wondering if it’s just the image haha, since we had it happen for a few different files. Appreicate the quick fix, have a good weekend!

messages.text: Hi <@U039WK9NWA0> - We’re adjusting SM Pro and we don’t want to have the forum linked anymore. We managed to remove it ourselves from most places, EXCEPT the Learning Hub navigation tab. Is there a way we can edit this in the future or is it hard-coded? And the way to change it is within code only?

elements.text: - We’re adjusting SM Pro and we don’t want to have the forum linked anymore. We managed to remove it ourselves from most places, EXCEPT the Learning Hub navigation tab. Is there a way we can edit this in the future or is it hard-coded? And the way to change it is within code only?

replies.text: <@UL2E9PUQP> Would you please check Manu's question?

elements.text: Would you please check Manu's question?

replies.text:
Hi <@U059AC59LLF>,
The Learning Hub navigation is coming from a custom ACF block, and the ‘Forum’ link is currently hard-coded inside the theme here: `stacked-marketer/blocks/learning-hub/dashboard-nav/dashboard-nav.php`
That’s why it isn’t editable from the WordPress admin.

We can either make this specific change directly without touching the rest of the codebase, or if you’d like, I can convert it into an editable field so future changes can be done from the dashboard.

Also, before we apply the change, do you want us to remove the *‘Forum’* tab from the *Your Bookmarks* section as well, or just from the Learning Hub navigation?

elements.text:
,
The Learning Hub navigation is coming from a custom ACF block, and the ‘Forum’ link is currently hard-coded inside the theme here:

That’s why it isn’t editable from the WordPress admin.

We can either make this specific change directly without touching the rest of the codebase, or if you’d like, I can convert it into an editable field so future changes can be done from the dashboard.

Also, before we apply the change, do you want us to remove the
section as well, or just from the Learning Hub navigation?

replies.text: Just removing it now is fine and yes, from Your Bookmarks too, please.

elements.text: Just removing it now is fine and yes, from Your Bookmarks too, please.

replies.text:
All set. The Forum has been removed from both the Learning Hub navigation and the Your Bookmarks section.
Let us know if you want anything else adjusted.

elements.text:
All set. The Forum has been removed from both the Learning Hub navigation and the Your Bookmarks section.
Let us know if you want anything else adjusted.

elements.text:
It was down for a couple of minutes. Back online again.

It seems they have a scheduled maintenance currently in progress:

messages.text: Hi <@U039WK9NWA0> - is there any agenda for today’s call that is coming up that I should look at? Or we can also do async catchup here on Slack if there’s no big news from your side.
